title: AMD Ryzen 5 3600 with Wraith Stealth Cooler drops to all-time low $67 on Amazon
summary: AMD's Ryzen 5 3600 processor has hit its lowest ever price on Amazon, according to popular price tracking websites, and it comes with a boxed cooler.

title: Microsoft announces first test build for Windows 11 26H1, aimed at 'specific silicon' — Rumor mill suggests first "H1" release in Windows 11's history might be reserved for upcoming Arm PCs
summary: Windows 11 26H1 has just been made official by Microsoft, with its first build released in the Canary channel for Insiders. Unlike what the name might suggest, this is not a feature update, rather a special update meant to roll in support for ARM-based devices, with lots of juicy rumors floating ar…

title: The 'Phantom' claims to be world's first transparent computer monitor, touts 5,000 nits of HDR brightness — 24-inch 4K panel from Virtual Instruments launches Q4
summary: The Phantom employs beam-splitting technology similar to what's used in aviation HUDs, or teleprompters, to reflect a screen onto a half-glass, half-mirror surface, giving it that transparent look. It also claims to have adjustable transparency, meaning you can have a completely opaque monitor if y…

title: Bank of America sued over not paying workers for PC boot up time in proposed class action lawsuit
summary: Bank of America is facing a proposed class and collective action lawsuit that accuses the company of failing to pay hundreds of hourly workers for time spent booting their computers.

title: Computer tech refurbs GPU clogged with tar and nicotine from 17 years of use by a smoker — 'I am not blowing on that; I’m getting cancer from this' says repair technician
summary: This is what 17 years of smoking could do to your graphics card.

title: 25 years ago today, Microsoft released DirectX 8 and changed PC graphics forever — How programmable shaders laid the groundwork for the future of modern GPU rendering
summary: The games we enjoy today would be unimaginably different without the improvements ushered in by DirectX 8 and its programmable shaders. Shader Model 1.0 introduced per-pixel programmable lighting, letting developers write custom code to control how light interacted with objects, rather than relying…

title: Corsair Sabre v2 Pro review: 36g but maybe too lightweight on features
summary: The Corsair Sabre v2 Pro is an incredibly lightweight (36g) mouse that feels good and glides like a dream. But the software is web-based — and that's a problem when your mouse has no profile or DPI switch buttons.

title: The world's ‘tiniest GPU’ heads to production — 200,000-transistor TinyGPU v2.0 can render gamepad-manipulated 3D images with up to 1K triangles in real-time
summary: The ‘tiniest GPU’ has gotten a big update with the new TinyGPU v2.0 offering interactive 3D rasterization, with transformation & lighting tech.

title: Hard drives on backorder for two years as AI data centers trigger HDD shortage — delays forcing rapid transition to QLC SSDs
summary: Artificial intelligence has taken yet another victim. After GPUs and memory, storage is now facing a shortage as well, at least in the enterprise space. Production capacity for nearline storage, fueled by high-capacity server HDDs, is booked for the next two years. Cloud providers are switching to …

title: No Longer Evil Thermostat hack strips Google from Nest thermostat to heat your home better — open source project revives sunsetted hardware, gives more precise control
summary: Google’s sunsetted Nest Gen 1 and Gen 2 thermostats have been given a new breath of life by a frustrated developer's No Longer Evil Thermostat firmware.

title: Laid-off Intel employee allegedly steals 'Top Secret' files, then disappears — ex-engineer downloaded 18,000 files before vanishing
summary: A former Intel software engineer who spent over a decade with the company allegedly stole several thousand documents, including confidential ones, after he was laid off.

title: DIY Amiga sound sampler circuit mystery solved 32 years later — Magazine instructions had key component spec typos
summary: A three-decade old 'Amiga mystery' has been solved by an intrepid electronics-focused TechTuber.

title: 500 disposable vapes recycled into a powerwall to power a house and workshop — enough juice for up to eight hours of home usage or three days of work
summary: By salvaging rechargeable batteries from thousands of used disposable vapes, UK-based YouTuber Chris Doel built a 50V power system that can run his workshop and home.

title: Japanese PC shops limit SSD, HDD, and RAM purchases to prevent hoarding as storage and memory shortage takes hold — buying a full PC unlocks higher purchase limits
summary: The impact of the massive AI demand for storage and memory is now hitting retail stores in Japan.

title: Investigators recover black boxes from UPS plane crash, detail data recovery process — NTSB successfully extracts cockpit audio from charred remains
summary: The NTSB has successfully recovered the cockpit audio from the ill-fated UPS 2967.

title: Modern motherboard features explained: Connectors, headers, ports, and chipsets decoded
summary: Here is a diagram of major ports, headers, and slots common on today’s motherboards, plus a guide to expansion slots, RAM and form factors.

title: SanDisk reportedly jacks up flash prices by 50% as memory makers cash in on AI-fueled demand
summary: As AI datacenters scoop up limited wafer supply, both DRAM and flash prices skyrocket.

title: Retro PC Gaming the Easy Way with DOSBox Pure Unleashed
summary: Retro gaming is part hobby and part historical preservation, and DOSBox Pure Unleashed is here to help keep those old games alive, despite our aging reflexes being incapable of beating Tomb Raider 2’s Venice level.

title: AMD warns the Intel and Nvidia partnership is a risk to its business — quarterly report outlines risk from 'increased competition and pricing pressure'
summary: AMD lists the Nvidia's $5 billion investment in Intel as a specific risk in its quarterly report.

title: Nvidia's RTX 5000 Super could be cancelled or get pricier due to AI-induced GDDR7 woes — rumor claims 3 GB memory chips are now too valuable for consumer GPUs
summary: Nvidia RTX 5000 Super series might be canceled due to AI-induced GDDR7 shortage, as rumors suggest that 3GB GDDR7 chips will be hard to come by.

title: AMD’s record quarter shows strength in client and AI, as Ryzen leads the charge — but data center dominance could be out of reach
summary: AMD has posted its highest quarterly revenue to date, booking $9.2 billion for Q3 2025. The company broke records in both its client and data center segments, with the Ryzen 7 9800X3D powering a rebound in laptop and desktop sales.

summary: Elon Musk said Tesla may need to build its own massive “TeraFab” chip plant to secure enough AI processors, a move that would make Tesla one of the world’s largest chipmakers, but experts like Nvidia’s Jensen Huang warn that creating a modern semiconductor process and fab is vastly more complex tha…

title: Explosive AI buildout brings into question water supply concerns — exploring how data centers could curb water demands
summary: Explosive data center construction projects under the new AI boom may threaten to damage local water sources and compete with citizens for access to clean drinking water.

title: Linux software management made simple with Discover
summary: Software management in Linux can be a daunting task for the uninitiated, so when Discover popped up, offering an easy-to-use and powerful user interface, we had to take a look.

title: The world is overly reliant on one US-located mine for critical chipmaking material, but China is working to break the stranglehold — China investing over $14 million in synthetic quartz manufacturing to diversify away from US dependency
summary: High-purity quartz is crucial for semiconductor manufacturing, and you can only get it naturally from the mine in North Carolina.

title: Substrate's claims about revolutionary ASML-beating chipmaking technology scrutinized, analyst likens the venture to a fraud — report pokes holes in the startup's technology, messaging, and leaders
summary: Analyst likens Substrate's tech, messaging, and leadership to a fraud.

title: Asus to include sag detection for monstrous new ROG Matrix RTX 5090 GPU — Level Sense can warn users of a mere 0.10 degree shift
summary: Asus' new ROG Matrix RTX 5090 GPU is so big that it will ship with Level Sense technology at launch. The feature can detect a shift of just 0.10 degrees to help prevent GPU sag.

title: Corsair HX1000i SHIFT 1000W power supply review
summary: A revolutionary power supply that reimagines cable management with side-mounted connectors and integrated iCUE ecosystem control, delivering flagship performance for builders willing to embrace its unique compatibility requirements and premium pricing.

title: Storied Windows dev reminisces about Microsoft's first hardware product 45 years ago — the Z-80 SoftCard was an Apple II add-in card
summary: Raymond Chen has shared some insight into the development of Microsoft’s first hardware product, the Z-80 SoftCard, from 1980.

title: GTA 6 delayed again, this time to November 2026 — Rockstar says extra time needed to deliver quality that players have 'come to expect and deserve'
summary: Rockstar has just announced that perhaps the most highly anticipated game in history has been delayed once again. Originally set to release on May 26, 2026, GTA VI will now hit consoles on November 19, 2026 — marking a six-month delay, similar to initial pushback from Fall 2025.
